intro: Ageratina glabrata, commonly known as white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of flowers. The plant is known for its dense, fluffy white or pale blue inflorescences that appear in late summer to early autumn. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Ageratina glabrata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
